page.title: 07Places of Worship
page.content: The parish church of{St. Lawrence stands on a hill to the north of the village.There are traces of Saxon stonework but the church is believed to date from the middle of the twelfth century.The Norman nave is particularly distinctive with round pillars, a high roof and a fully preserved clerestory. The transept and chancel were both added in the fourteenth century. There is also a parish church in Hodthorpe. Apart from the Anglican churches, there is a{Methodist church}in Whitwell. The chapel has regular coffee mornings and charity raising activities. The old Methodist church is now used as a civic centre, where a wide range of community meetings are held.
